intro: Psoralea simplex, commonly known as the slender psoralea, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which is characterized by its legume fruits and nitrogen-fixing abilities. The plant typically grows as a small shrub, reaching heights of up to 30 centimeters. Its leaves are pinnately compound, and it produces small, yellowish-white flowers arranged in racemose inflorescences. Psoralea simplex is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments.
